header:
The QA Hackathon was last weekend, and as a result there have been a lot of blog posts
about it this week. Lots gets done at the QAH, and everyone is encouraged to blog about it,
to make clear the value of it both to the sponsors (without whom the QAH couldn't happen)
and to the Perl community.
If you use MongoDB from Perl, please check out David Golden's request.
subject: The QA Hackathon happened

entries.text: If you only read one blog post about the QAH, it should probably be this one, which tries to give a flavour of what happened.
entries.title: The QA Hackathon 2016 was a great success!
entries.author: neil_bowers

entries.text: Rik's report on the QAH.
entries.title: RJBS: I went to the Perl QA Hackathon in Rugby!
entries.author: ricardo_signes

entries.title: JBERGER: My Perl QA Hackathon 2016
entries.text: Joel's report on what he did at the QAH.
entries.author: joel_berger

entries.title: ANDK: QA Hackathon in Rugby, Warwickshire, 2016
entries.text: As ever, Andreas seemed to be everywhere with everyone at the QAH. This is his report.

entries.title: ISHIGAKI: QA Hackathon 2016 in Rugby
entries.text: Ishigaki-san continued his work from last year to port PAUSE over to Plack. He also provided a bridge to some Japanese Perl hackers, including MAKAMAKA.
entries.author: kenichi_ishigaki

entries.title: NEWELLC: Perl QA Hackathon report
entries.text: Colin's report on the work he did at the QAH, related to PAUSE permissions.

entries.author: olaf_alders
entries.text: There was a whole MetaCPAN section at the QAH this year, which grew as the weekend went on. This is Olaf's summary of what they got done.
entries.title: MetaCPAN at the 2016 Perl QA Hackathon

entries.author: steffen_schwigon
entries.title: RENORMALIST: Perl QA Hackathon report - part 1: Perl::Formance
entries.text: Just one of Steffen's reports on the QAH (see them all here). He worked on benchmarking of Perl 5, amongst other things.
This was Sawyer's first QAH, and given that he was strapped down and made to take on the Pumpking role for Perl 5, he may not go again!
entries.title: XSAWYERX: My first QAH (QA Hackathon)
entries.author: sawyer_x
matthew_horsfall
entries.title: ALH: Perl QAH 2016
entries.text: Matt's blog post.

entries.author: philippe_bruhat
entries.title: BOOK: My Perl QA Hackathon 2016
entries.text: He didn't wear the expected number of pink shirts at the QA Hackathon, but I did see at least one. He's a friend, which is why I'm allowed to mock him rather than talk about the useful things he did.

entries.title: The Intern: Perl QA Hackathon 2016
entries.author: oriol_soriano
entries.text: This year we tried an experiment: Oriol came as The QAH Intern. He joined a number of discussions, but joined Barbie and Doug Bell working on CPAN Testers for most of the time. I hope we get as good an intern next year!

entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
The module list permissions in PAUSE (the 'm' case in 06perms.txt) have now all been removed, simplifying the permissions model for PAUSE.
entries.title: The end of modulelist permissions
entries.author: neil_bowers
sawyer_x
entries.text: Two weekly summaries for the price of one!
entries.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: April 14th-27th

entries.text: An update from Flávio on his Perl 5 to Java compiler.
entries.title: Android App with the Perl5 to Java compiler
entries.author: flavio_glock
jonathan_worthington
entries.text: It seems there really is no such thing as too much information about call frames!
entries.title: Refactoring and torture

entries.author: zoffix_znet
entries.text: Zoffix compares Perl's S/// operator to Perl's s/// relative.
entries.title: Perl 6: The S/// Operator

entries.text: Charlie has a tip for people wanting to do some Perl 6 on Windows.
entries.title: Need Perl6 modules on Windows then use Zef
entries.author: charlie_gonzalez

entries.text: Zoffix shows some of the ways you can extend core types in Perl 6.
entries.title: Extra-Typical Perl 6
entries.author: zoffix_znet
joel_berger
entries.title: Reflections on Test2
entries.text: One of the big topics at the QAH was Test2, and the way forward. This is a gnarly issue, and no decision was ever going to satisfy everyone. But the Test2 group, led by Chad Granum, worked hard to find the best solution. Joel summarises the story so far.

entries.author: david_golden
entries.title: Stand up and be counted: Annual MongoDB Developer Survey
entries.text: If you use Perl and MongoDB, David need your help: please fill in the MongoDB developer experience survey.

entries.author: dave_cross
entries.title: Training in Cluj – The Poll
entries.text: Dave wants to know what training courses people are interested in for YAPC::EU this year.

entries.title: Alpine Perl Workshop 2016
entries.text: This year, Austrian and Swiss Perl Monger groups join forces to host the first Alpine Perl Workshop, taking place at the University of Innsbruck on 2nd and 3rd September 2016 (that’s a week after YAPC::Europe).  They're looking for talks on Perl and other interesting things.

entries.author: moritz_lenz
entries.text: Moritz continues his series on automating deployments.
entries.title: Automating Deployments: Stage 2: Uploading
My Workflow for Building Distros
entries.text: Ron Savage shares how he releases his CPAN distributions.
entries.author: ron_savage

entries.title: Refactoring Dancer 2 app, using before hook
entries.author: gabor_szabo

entries.title: Overview of current maintainer fails
entries.text: I thought twice about including this, since (a) it's not constructive, (b) contains personal attacks, and (c) has a number of inaccuracies. But Perl Weekly seeks to reflect what's being discussed in the world of Perl, so here it is. Reini lists a number of core modules he claims are no longer maintained. But at the QA Hackathon I know that JSON::PP, Pod::Simple, ExtUtils::MakeMaker, Devel::PPPort, and Test-Simple were all worked on, and possibly more.
entries.author: reini_urban
